website_summaries.verdict: Blade works well for both hunting and camping purposes. Reasonably good price point for a durable knife.
pros: Ships with sheath and belt clip
Handle and blade are tightly connected for sturdy feel
Basic handle shape fits the hand well
Performs a number of jobs effectively
cons: Knife fits loosely in included sheath
Blade needs to be sharpened often

customer_reviews.title: But the shear is terrible! They use a small bump in the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: I was actually really surprised at the quality of this knife when I got it. But the sheath is terrible! They use a small bump in the plastic for retention instead of molding the plastic around the hand guard part of the knife. Problem is... that bump wears down after after few times in and out of the sheath and then it won't hold the knife. If you want a great knife for a great price and you don't care about the sheath... thus us a great purchase. But to buy this and then have to purchase a better sheath... well... why not just spring for the real thing and buy an Esee 3.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Picked this out for my hiking kit. Wanted a good entry-level bushcraft knife. Used this knife to baton an entire bundle of firewood into kindling and fuel wood, make some feather sticks, and then used a ferro rod firestarter on the spine of the knife. Made a great fire with this knife and ferro rod alone. Edge still very sharp after an afternoon of batoning wood. Only wear was paint rubbing off the high points on the blade. Sheath clip is junk, but easily removed. Going to get some leather to make a belt loop and a firestarter loop. After getting this knife, I don't think I need to get a more expensive knife. This one does it all.
customer_reviews.author: Letter Size

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Blade edge began to chip off my first time cutting a branch.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Only thing missing is a top brand name......
customer_reviews.text: I've been collecting knives all my life and I'm 40. First knife from my older brother when I was 6. Since then I've had quality knives,cheap knives,name brand knives, and of course, name brand knives that were disappointing.... This knife is great. Especial for the price. The only reason it's not more expensive is BECAUSE it's NOT name brand. It has a beefy quality you can feel. I have a ESEE IZULA and I love it. The only difference between this knife and an izula; it's a fraction of the price. I would trust this knife in the woods any day and would buy it a million times over!
customer_reviews.author: anthony p cable

customer_reviews.title: A good $19.80 knife? Ugh, yes. Very good, actually.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, yes, It's Chinese. But a lot of stuff is these days. Ask CRKT, Kershaw, Buck and just about all of them. And with this blade, it is honestly hard to find anything wrong. I've put it through the motions, hard. It does everything well. Check out the YouTube videos on it. I always try to buy American when I can, but for this price, it's going to surprise you. It's $19.80 as of this review. Three people can barely eat lunch at McDonald's for that. That's the end of my justification for giving this one a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and value for money!
customer_reviews.text: This CIMA really surprised me. I knew it's a Chinese knock off of an ESEE 4, but had no idea of the quality and heft of the product. It is much heavier than I'd expected and feels bullet proof in my hand. The sheath and steel belt loop plate are good quality, and hold the blade securely. I don't have a single negative comment to make about this product and would not only buy it again, but recommend to anyone wanting a smaller workhorse knife for camping, bushcrafting or jobs around the house. The seller got it to me in a very timely manner 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: The knife has held up well thru a couple of days hard use. Retains a good edge and isn't too hard to put an edge on. The handle scales are discoloring from sweat and the sheath is very hard to remove the knife from. Other than that a great knife! Found out that the handle scales will return to its original color if you can put it down for a couple of days. This could be the best and most useful sheath knife I own. The difficulty of removing it from the sheath is the only reason for the 4 star rating otherwise it would be a 5+ rating
customer_reviews.author: NoNameJoe

customer_reviews.title: Good knife.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy knife for size and only factory "sharp". Steel seems very good. Scales need some finish sanding. Scales are also liquid absorbent (shoe polish/dye should fix). Knife rattles in sheath. Sheath rivets need tightening. All screws need tightening. All minor problems and easy to fix. Overall seems like a very good knife for the price if you don't mind having to give it the once over.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: This will be short....
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this friggin knife. I'm not gonna repeat everything that's already been said.....but maybe reiterate a couple key points..... If you shy from this because you think it's a cheap knockoff...By all means, be the fool with your money. Yes. The sheath is a bit rattling, and I'll most likely use the 'cloth tape' another reviewer suggested. Yes. The metal belt clip is outrageously heavy for the size. I'll admit, that I thought that was an exaggeration.....Up until I detached it. OMG! Personally, I think this is one of the most incredible deals/surprises I've ever had with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Habic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Budget Knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife better then what I was expecting...came very sharp out of the box. I saw reviews on YouTube about this knife and gave it a try and I have to saw they were right it's an awesome knife that fit the budget as backup knife. Highly recommend if your looking for a great budget knife. The only thing that wasn't great was the sheath but I just made a Kydex sheath for mine and now it's perfect for carry.
customer_reviews.author: Lphisane

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive Knife
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it. This knife is cheap. You’re gonna be rough with it. Throw it around and hack at things. Use it and abuse it. But this knife will stand up to the abuse! Razor sharp out of the box with no signs of dulling yet. The weight of the knife will surprise you when you take it out of the box. The knife clicks into the sheath and stays, I never have to worry about it falling out. Everyone I’ve shown this knife to thinks it’s a $100+ knife. Get this knife, you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The knife it self is pretty good the finish is nice the fit is close with the handle scales just a hair proud in spots but I'm talking barely noticeable . The knife arrived sharp very sharp . It's a nice sized knife and balances well in the hand and feels good . The one thing that takes away a star is the sheath it's just bad . It'll do until I fix up something better . It holds the knife well it doesn't fall out easily but it rattles and the metal clip is cheap and nasty . But it works but I hate it. HTH
customer_reviews.author: tb9

customer_reviews.title: The knife is great! Although it's made in China
customer_reviews.text: The knife is great ! Although it's made in China, it is of a gooooood quality. The knife is sturdy, full tang, and very well made. It is very sharp out of the box. Handle feels nice in my hand, but kinda slippery. However, it doesn't slip from the hand when wet. It comes with a plastic sheath equiped with a big, removable, metal belt clip. For the size, it has some good weight to it. Overall, it's an awsome knife, for a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Chui

customer_reviews.title: Great budget knife
customer_reviews.text: Great budget knife. I used it recently on a 4 day backpacking trip for light battoning and food prep. Held it's edge nicely and took a beating as well. The belt loop is horrible, heavy, and awkward. The sheath is mediocre but holds tight.
customer_reviews.author: TNPrime

customer_reviews.title: I am fine with the sheath
customer_reviews.text: I rarely accept imitations. This is the exception. If the ESEE 3 is a 10, this is a solid 8. And for 20% the price, a steal. 80% of the quality for only 20% of the price. I keep this in my purse next to my compact 9. What a pair. I am fine with the sheath. The all metal clip is a little heavy, but the sheath retention has been 100% and not a problem. Micarta scales are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Leftwing

customer_reviews.title: It's annoying and I think it would eventually dull the edge ...
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for the knife! Very impressive, especially for the price. I'd only give the sheath about 3 stars. It is too heavy, and while it secures the blade well, the blade rattles around in the sheath. It's annoying and I think it would eventually dull the edge some. But back to the knife: heavy, solid. Blade is think and very sharp. Looks like it would take a beating. Nice feel in the hand, very well balanced. Essentially a quality OKC RAT 3 clone for about 1/4th the price. Also, while this does not matter, I was also impressed with the nice box the knife was packaged in. Would make for good gift presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Rdeschain

customer_reviews.title: The BEST knife for the money
customer_reviews.text: this knife blew me away with its quality, there is another brand selling this exact knife for 5 times more. same knife different stamp. save yourself some money and get this beast instead. I will be buying several more soon. The knife has a thick full tang capable of taking a beating. it came incredibly sharp out the box and I barely had to do any sharping on it before honing it in razor sharp. the handle fits in your hand nicely. Isnt too thick or thin, just right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive bushcraft/survival knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a cheap beater knife and actually grew fond of it for bushcraft really thick blade and easy to control not the best steel in the world but it’s easy to sharpen and hold the edge plus if I lose it I don’t care I was suprised the coating on the blade stayed on for acouple trips and most of it is still on it reminds me of the medium sized esee knives
customer_reviews.author: Brent couturiaux

customer_reviews.title: Decent knife for price. Useless sheath
customer_reviews.text: Knife is a good quality knock off of ontario. For the price is good. Not great...but good. The sheath however is horrible. The metal belt loop is way too heavy. So cant use it. Either way....cant use the sheath because it does not hold retention. If you put knife inside the sheath and shake it upside down, knife falls out. Id give it 3.5 stars if the sheath held retention.
customer_reviews.author: THESMITHS

customer_reviews.title: Knife hard to remove from sheath at first
customer_reviews.text: Cool knife! Very solid knife. Very hard to remove knife from sheath. This knife will definitely not fall out of this sheath but it's not a quick draw so don't depend on this for emergency situations. After awhile the knife is easier to remove from sheath. Handle is very smooth which makes it hard to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this particular blade but it surprised me and passed all my expectations. The blade came sharp right out the box its very strong and sturdy, cuts really smooth overall i am extremely happy with it and the price is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Solid knife for the price for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this knife, especially for the price. I’ve taken it into the woods and banged on it a bit to test it out. The blade has kept its edge rather well, and it’s thick spine makes me confident it will handle abuse. My only complaint is how heavy it is for such a small knife. Excellent value if you’re looking for a cheap but durable beater knife.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: For 20 bucks, this is quite a buy.
customer_reviews.text: This was a pleasant surprise. I wasn't expecting it to live up to the reviews, but figured if it was close, I'd be satisfied. But let me say, this is one very nice knife. Cut a little patch of hair on my arm like it was a razor. Looks like some of the Ontario knives, and feels a lot like a couple of my smaller Esees. It fits the Kydex sheath perfectly--nothing fancy about the sheath, but it's nice and tight. For 20 bucks, this is quite a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Dennie

customer_reviews.title: Full Tang and ready to cut anything
customer_reviews.text: This knife does awesome. I wear it every single backpacking trip and it proves to be a useful tool. Great for making feathersticks for fires, sharpening sticks, cutting through branches, cutting a hole open in a can, opening packages, digging, cutting rope, a hammer, pretty much anything. I can trust this knife and know the quality of it is amazing because it is full tang and isn't going anywhere. So sturdy. Give it a good sharpening and this treats you well
customer_reviews.author: JdmSkylineGtr

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Bushcrafter
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great knife with very nice fit & finish. It's difficult to attest to the quality of the steel without really beating it up, but it takes and holds an edge well. The micarta handles are nicely finished, but I hit them with a medium grit sandpaper to give a little more texture for grip. It's more or less a copy of similar Esee and Ontario knives. However, the handle fits my hand much better than the Ontario Rat, and it's way more affordable than the Esee. Overall, it's hard to go wrong with a knife of this quality for around $20. I'm confident that you won't regret buying this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish are superb. It's hard to believe this knive cost less than $25. Quickly compaired to my RAT 3 it's much beefier in the hand (not a bad thing), similar size, and has a adequate sheath. For being an average steel it does seem to be very hard and is able to keep an edge for a reasonable amount of time. Sometimes with cheaper knives you can tell where they've cut corners. This knife is a rare exception.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Riddle

customer_reviews.title: and visually speaking a pretty good one for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's an ESEE copy, and visually speaking a pretty good one for the money. It feels good in the hand and looks the part, unfortunately, the steel is extremely sub-par, visibly chipping upon one or two stroked on a Ferro rod. Along with the steel, the kydex sheath it came in was incredibly loose. I used a hair dryer to tighten it a little, but it still rattles.
customer_reviews.author: Jdh

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: i like the size of this knife. its slightly bigger than a rat 3 . more handle to grip and longer blade.sheath is a bit heavy. i did not have any issues with the sheath retention on the 1st one i bought but i did with the 2nd one. both knives came sharp and nicely crafted. for 24$ i will not complain. i just stuck one knife in a leather sheath.
customer_reviews.author: CROMERO

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the grind and the handle almost equal that of much more expensive knives like from ESEE
customer_reviews.text: The knife itself is very well made, and solid. It is full tang and very thick. The quality of the grind and the handle almost equal that of much more expensive knives like from ESEE. The blade is sharp, and seems to hold an edge as well as any stainless steel. The only real CON is that it is loose in the sheath. Not only does it rattle, but the knife is held in place by friction, and without making some modifications I would not trust it to stay in place by itself. It was easy to fix with a piece of duct tape. Overall, this is an incredible knife for $20.
customer_reviews.author: Camping Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a down and dirty small companion for my Esee 6. Have to say I'm impressed so far. While not the quality of the Esee, it's actually very good value for what it costs. It comes sharp, is well constructed and feels remarkably solid in the hand. The sheath is functional, neither great, nor bad, just there and does its job well enough. If I lost this tomorrow I'd order another one in a heartbeat. If you're looking for a 3-inch blade that you're planning to abuse more than you'd like to do to an expensive knife but still hold up well, you really can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: NibberJammies

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knockoff of the ESEE
customer_reviews.text: Knock off of the ESEE Better to spend a little more, and get the real thing. Not a *bad* knife, and if it is all you can afford, well, that's life. But expect to spend some time reshaping the edge to a useful profile, and the steel won't hold an edge as well as the ESEE offering. Tossed this one in a tackle box, it's ok for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Beefy little knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife for twenty dollars. It has a hefty metal belt clip that looks like it will last a while. The knife itself is bigger and thicker than I expected, and fills up my hand. A good option if you don't want to spend two or three times as much for an Ontario knife or similarly expensive name brand. This is the Chinese knockoff, literally. That said, it would make a nice inexpensive gift. I know I would be happy to receive it. Anyways if you loose it you won't cry too much...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you expect.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in yesterday as a test of the size, wanted to get a feel for the blade before dropping the money on an esee, seems to be pretty well made. Like everyone else the sheath is loose, I took the lanyard from the sheath and put it into the knife, then take the tail and slide it in with the knife, that took care of the rattle. I know it's not the optimal fix but it works. As of now I'm gonna go ahead and give it 5 stars for being exactly what's promised a budget knife capable of hitting above it's weight class. I'll update after some more use
customer_reviews.author: cliff shantie

customer_reviews.title: Great budget survival knife.
customer_reviews.text: I can give this nothing but 5 stars. I've used it a couple months and I've made feather sticks, stripped wood, split wood, cut rope and plastic and even used it with a fire steel. This knife works great and sharpens up razor sharp. It's every bit as good as my friends Esee knife. Only complaint would be that the clip it comes with is very large and that it doesn't work very well, but it's removable . I made some belt loops out of paracord.
customer_reviews.author: Jcnbama

customer_reviews.title: A Great knife and a good sheath
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not expecting much but I was surprised this knife is really really nice it comes sharp the fit and finish is perfect the sheath it pretty nice too other reviews say it's no good and I doesn't hold the knife. My sheath holds it really good a little to good it's a little hard to pull it out but that's okay by me I'd rather have it really in there than fall out when I'm out in the woods yes it does make a little rattling when you shake it but over all it's awesome
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Tcaciuc

customer_reviews.title: Handle fits my hand well allowing for excellent control. So far
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality knife. Is it a knock-off of another well known brand? Yes. Does that hurt it's functionality or usefulness? No. Handle fits my hand well allowing for excellent control. So far, have not seen any issues with holding an edge, but have only owned for a short time. Feel free to pay more for the "original" if that is important to you, or save a few bucks for other important gear and still get a high quality knife.
customer_reviews.author: KDB

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT PRODUCT! Great E.D.C. KNIFE for every day carry. I've had no problems wearing this knife, I love the sheath because it's clip-on and go! No pain in the bud belt loops that will discourage me from E.D.C. i can wear it inside the waist band or outside. From what I've read so far it's not the "GLOCK" of knives as far as that goes with knife guys for " whom I have a great deal of respect for " but, I'm only using this knife for personal protection carries well! perfect fixed blade $18 dollars free shipping
customer_reviews.author: reginald

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great ESEE 3 knock off. I beat the crap out of this thing. Keeps an edge relatively well and sharpens easily. Sheath is actually comfortable to wear and holds the knife firmly. Obviously their are much better knives but this is a good deal for the money. (Even with the Chinesium metal)
customer_reviews.author: Biesewel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my first fixed blade. After some reviews and watching videos I chose this since j knew I would beat it to crap. It has been working out fantastic and holds an edge really well. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a fixed blade camping knife before spending significantly more to then not use it.
customer_reviews.author: Josue E. Tirado

customer_reviews.title: I really like knife, but the only thing is my blade ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like knife, but the only thing is my blade is not staying in the sheath. I don't know how to fix it or if it can be fixed. I wish I could get another sheath, but I was told I can't, so I'm looking for another sheath. I can't find one that will fit my CIMA-1. The knife is well built and is does keep a sharp edge if you maintain it. I do want to get another one in my EDC gear.
customer_reviews.author: Visa Card

customer_reviews.title: OK for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not quite as hardened as they say it is! Sharpens OK but it doesn't really last that well and the grind is rather uneven when you first get it. Easy enough to rectify with a coarse stone and it looks like an ESEE 3 or 4! Not a bad value at all! Add a tech-lok to the sheath and it may be just what you want!
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but I like it. I guess it's a knock-off of an esee. Saw two you tube reviews. One from Joe Robinet and one from Dutch Bushcrafter Knives. Both did a test where they pounded the knife in with the blade parallel to the ground and stood on it and bounced a little bit on it. On the Robinet test it survived on the DBK test it did not. I guess I just won't pound mine into a log and stand on it. I gave it a 4 based on price and the 50/50 chance it will hold up to that test.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Labosky

customer_reviews.title: Can't afford not to have this super knife
customer_reviews.text: By far and away one of the best knives I've owned. Terrific bargain. Super hard steel and sharp as a scalpel. Won't need to sharpen for some time. Work's well at baton and feather duty, and with ferro rod. I'd like to carve some diamonding in the handle but so far it hasn't slipped in my hand. The sheath is terrible though, at least mine was.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: great woodcraft knife at a great price
customer_reviews.text: served me very well. showed up a day early and shaving sharp out of the box. the first camping trip i took it on, i ended up using it more than my bigger knife and my hatchet combined. great woodcraft knife at a great price. edit: after two years, i'm only had to strop it a couple times to keep it sharp. by far my favorite camp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bates

customer_reviews.title: Feels very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great knife love the size and weight defendant recommended. Grip when dry is a little to smooth but when wet grips really well. Balance off but that only matters for throwing. Would buy another if they had different colors for grips and blade.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for buck...
customer_reviews.text: Was very impressed with knife and sheath, especially for price. I bought two, knives came sharp enough. Minor finish blemishes on sheath, and sheath is pretty heavy. All in, very much worth the price...money saved can be spent on custom sheath and you will still come out ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Knife is really nice, good edge on the blade and pretty comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: Knife is really nice, good edge on the blade and pretty comfortable handle. 3 stars only because the sheath doesn't fit right and the knife falls out very easily. For the price I guess I shouldn't be complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, love it
customer_reviews.text: Let’s make this simple, great knife, feels great in the hand. Holds a very sharp edge. Will do every thing a more expensive will do. I have 2. I have over 20 fixed blade knifes, some over $200.00, love them all. But this is the knife I carry 70% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: darry johnson

customer_reviews.title: won't lock in sheath and is heavy
customer_reviews.text: won't stay in the sheath and is very heavy. I read other reviews that it wouldn't lock in, as well as the fixes. I presumed it was just a matter of adjustments but there doesnt seem to be a lasting solution, mostly due, I think, to the excessive weight of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C. Wise

customer_reviews.title: With work you can make make it a better fit. The lashing points and it being moldable ...
customer_reviews.text: The sheath is less than desirable. It's a very loose fit. When heated, the sheath is moldable. With work you can make make it a better fit. The lashing points and it being moldable are the only redeeming qualities. The knife is perfect for small "bushcraft" projects and as a backpack knife. That is a back up knife kept in your bag. It is the same quality metal used in the more expensive brands at a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Goad

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in 2 days...Ok edge...correct 20° angle...took 5 minutes to put great edge...knife rattles in kydex sheath...put in self stick soft side of Velcro to stop noise... didn't subtract star because overall package is very nice...sturdy full tang replaceable sturdy scales with lanyard hole...sheath has adjustable lanyard and extra lanyard holes...great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Snapp

customer_reviews.title: Better to start too tight than to loose the knife
customer_reviews.text: Some have been complaining about version 1 vs. ver. 2 with the first offering having a fit too tight between the knife and sheath. This is a friction/interference fit folks. Better to start too tight than to loose the knife. Use a flat file to take down the inside sheath material that "clips" the knife until you get the amount of resistance that you like. Take some material from both sides of the sheath interior. Test the fit frequently as you continue to file.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Buy low, get high quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have many very excellent knives and their cost reflects my belief in the steel used and quality. BUY THIS KNIFE! CIMA's 440C is tough, tough, tough and I can't figure out why... don't care! For the price, this is a steal! Use it in the kitchen or bushcraft AND it is EXTREMELY SHARP out of the box. I really can not say enough about this inexpensive jewel! P.S. rustygray said it! lol...if you ain't smart enough
customer_reviews.author: The Ape @ApezAttic

customer_reviews.title: Should have opted for Ontario knife
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had just payed the extra money for the Ontario knife. Overall not a bad knife but you can tell corners were cut and the sheath is really where that shines through. Not a bad purchase but nothing more than a beater for things where you don’t want to mess up your nice knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tamar

customer_reviews.title: Nice companion knife
customer_reviews.text: Nice companion knife. Rattles a little in the sheath, but a good strong knife. You can change the sheath to make it a cross draw. Good deal for the money. A copy of a more expensive knife. If lost or stolen won't break your heart.
customer_reviews.author: sj hay

customer_reviews.title: Quality Blade
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how good this knife is. I expect it to be good based on the reviews but I was really surprised. Compared to my Cold Steel Kobun, I trust this knife much much more. I know it's a knock off, but it goes to show you that you don't have to buy a 100-150 dollar knife to be assured that you are holding quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joor

customer_reviews.title: The Cima knives look good, yet to test it
customer_reviews.text: The Cima knives look good, yet to test it, but the sheath is real crap, the knife falls out even though all the screws were tightened, they were all loose whe it arrived ....., I tHink I bought the $29 dollar version, still quality control is out the window...., we shall see with the knife
customer_reviews.author: Juan Barreda

customer_reviews.title: It's a darn good knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife and have to say, it is a darn good knife. Well balanced, fits good in the hand. It is Chinese made, but think about, most of American made knives are made in Chinese. They claim, its a clone, well maybe so, but I can't afford those high priced knifes. The Sheath, is really loose, but I fixed that with two 1/4" Chicago Screws, now it doesn't rattle, or fall out. Great Knife.
customer_reviews.author: Corndog

customer_reviews.title: As good as higher priced models
customer_reviews.text: A friend swears by his Esee, but this knife goes toe-to-toe with his that cost 6 times as much. He lost one once and still wanted to spend $$ for another one. Convinced him to go this route as a cost effective alternative that performs just as well.
customer_reviews.author: E. James

customer_reviews.title: The knife was well made in regards to fit and ...
customer_reviews.text: The knife was well made in regards to fit and finish. However, the sheath was extremely loose and the knife falls out.
customer_reviews.author: pyroplop

customer_reviews.title: Fit and Finish better than i expected
customer_reviews.text: Blade was sharp right out of the box, Scales are fit well. I see some people have issues with the sheath being too loose, mine was the opposite, it was really tight making the blade difficult to unsheathe, i would rather have this as an issue than too loose. Over time the sheath loosened up a bit. I have had this knife for a while now and definitely prefer using this knife over a more expensive one -
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Knife seems like a winner, couldn't unscrew the metal belt clip at first
customer_reviews.text: Just reviewed my CIMA and it looks & feels good in the hand, want to take the metal belt clip off which I think will reduce it's weight but can't seem to figure out how given the backing disk is interrupted by the phillips screw post poking out through the flathead groove making using a flathead screwdriver, to hold it in place, impossible.. Update : Found the solution. Went to home depot, bought a 98 cent flathead out of the bargain bucket they got, took it to their "equipment rental" dept & the dude filed/ground down a post sized cut in the middle of the head so it fits either side of that screw backing disk, works perfectly. 98 cents!
customer_reviews.author: David Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably a great deal! I have put mine through moderate use and no issues. Sheath is useless or I would easily give this 5 stars. Will not hold knife without it falling out. Nice edge and easy to maintain. I would recommend this knife for anyone wanting a good camp/bushcraft type of knife on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: One of the most reliable and sturdy budget fixed blades that I have found yet
customer_reviews.text: One of the most reliable and sturdy budget fixed blades that I have found yet. Of course it's no Mora, and the sheath is a little bit on the heavy side, but I have been beating this blade mercilessly since I got it a few months ago, and so far it's taking everything I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: pamela kitt

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: The price made me hesitant of this knive. For the money you can't do much better. I carry a Zero Tolerance for my edc if that tells you anything about my taste in knives. This is a perfect mid sized fixed blade ready for rough use. The grip alone is worth the price. The sheath itself isn't bad but the clip is junk. Easily removed and lots of other options out there. Order two, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S

customer_reviews.title: Knife and sheath are perfect, only problem is mine looks used
customer_reviews.text: Knife and sheath are perfect, only problem is mine looks used. Has scratches all over back of sheath and some scratches on front. Might return for a new one which is what I purchased!!!! This was purchased as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Best fix blade for your money for sure!
customer_reviews.text: This knife has got to be the bang for your buck! Very nice weight to it, sharp right out of the box,nice kydex sheath and great retention! Amazing clone! Wouldnt even call it a clone.
customer_reviews.author: David Bianca totten

customer_reviews.title: A Boss
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a boss. It came to me razor sharp right out of box, the grind was perfect both sides dead ass even. Great weight and handle feels great in the hand. Stayed razor sharp after batoning 30 - 40 three to four inch round logs and 10 - 15 feather sticks. Works just as good as my Esee and Rat. Wished I'd found this sooner I would not have bought the Esee.
customer_reviews.author: Bushcraft Master

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty knife. The thick steel and full tang puts weight in your hand. The knife comes pretty sharp but with a couple of minutes on a strop it is literally razor sharp. If there is a fault it is that the handle is a bit small for hard jobs. Otherwise the knife feels good in your hand and easily can do heavy or fine cutting work. A remarkable knife for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's a knockoff of the more expensive knives but it does the same job! Bought this as a back up to my back up. Came in a nice box and comes with a plastic sheath that fits the knife to the tee. I read some other reviews and some said the knife didn't fit but I have to say that mine was perfect! Came very sharp and ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: higgins.j80

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!!!
customer_reviews.text: Liked these blades so much I have bought 3 total over the last couple months and even give them away as gifts. Great knife at a very good price and would be just as at home on a hunting trip, backpacker or even an EDC!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Dees

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat this for $20
customer_reviews.text: For less than $20 this knife is the truth. If you are an outdoorsman or somebody who uses knives alot, you need at least 1 of these. I will be getting at least 1 more. For less than $20 there is nothing to complain about with this knife. Exceeds expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, You can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I'm an outdoors-man of 17 consistent years of adventure and this is probably one of my favorite sheath knives. I've had it for a good while now (about 4 months) and have put it through its paces. It has held up exceptionally. It's edge still shaves hair off my arm. The only pit fall has to do with the sheath itself. It is made out of plastic and metal instead of kydex and metal, but that isn't even really a pit fall. Just a personal preference. I would highly recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: dedscorn

customer_reviews.title: Sheath so tight, it's unusable
customer_reviews.text: Knife is great so far but the sheath is too tight. Takes so much to release the knife. It won't come in handy if you need a quick draw. Holster is way too big and gets in the way of having more leverage to pull the knife any faster.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic knife for the money
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic knife for the money. The blade finish is well done, the scales fit perfectly, and the sheath is decent enough considering the price. 7cr17mov may not be a premium stainless but I've been using it for about a month now and it's holding up fine. I liked the knife so much I bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, sheath needs minor modification before use
customer_reviews.text: Knife is everything you'd want it to be for the price range. Sturdy, feels good, holds an edge reasonably well. Sheath is utter garbage out of the box. The belt clip doesn't fit securely, so trying to draw the knife just results in the whole thing coming off the belt. I just took off the metal belt clip and wove paracord through the screwholes. Works fine now. Sheath itself retains the knife well.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for $20. Excellent value. Tough and good quality. I really like the handles and have no complaints about the sheath. What more could you ask for in a 20 dollar knife? Is it an esee? No...And that’s not what you paid for either! Perfect for anyone on a budget. Buy 2 of these if you can. Have one as a car/truck knife and another in your pack. you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for a great price. New upgraded sheath holds the knife well, rattled a little bit easy to silence. Thick spine strong grips with good heft. All in all totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: randale n sparks

customer_reviews.title: YouTube Video
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife for the money. I especially like the sheath for the price point. If you would like to see a closer look into this knife and a comparison between it and a RAT-3 I have a video on my YouTube channel. Just type in Cima-1 Life In The Backwater
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wise man would buy 2 of these just because they are that good. Great quality work! Very sharp out of the box. They are manufactured better then some of the ontario rats I own :) to be honest.. A+++ budget knife..
customer_reviews.author: Aleksey

customer_reviews.title: A Great Knife at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife ... Fit and finish is good came razor sharp out if the box holds an edge very well and is easy to being the edge back with just a few passes on a stone or a strop .. makes a great truck knife,. Range knife , camp knife and I even have one in my bugout bag. This knife has taken everything I have put it through and come back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: This is a dandy little knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is a dandy little knife. It arrives very sharp. It's a great size for medium tasks, and has a nice heft to it. The sheath is just a plastic holder. It gets the job done, but you will probably need to heat up the place where it grips the handle scales for a more positive retention.
customer_reviews.author: not1word

customer_reviews.title: Great knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is very similar to a high end knife companies knife at a much higher price. The steel is not the same but it doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyCorn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sheath but great knife
customer_reviews.text: Love the knife. Has stayed sharp the whole time I’ve owned the knife. Really hard to dull. One major thing I don’t like is the sheath that is provided. The tension belt clip is horrible. For the first two days I had it on my side. Every time I went to pull the knife out, well I got the whole thing. I fixed mine by tax welding the belt clip on either side and has fixed that problem
customer_reviews.author: Justin lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: One of best bush craft knives you'll ever own. Solid , Shaving sharp right out of the box. For the money you can't beat it. Only drawback was the sheath. The blade tends to move / rattle a bit in the sheath but it holds the knife securely. Awesome knife. Very pleased with it. I rarely write reviews but this knife rates 5 stars. I only gave it 4 because of the sheath
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually pretty sharp right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Actually pretty sharp right out of the box. A good looking knife that is well balanced. The grip has a good feel to it, and I really like using this knife as my everyday carry around the farm.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I filet with it with ease. Wish it came with belt clip..then it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Deezo

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I received this knife two days after ordering. It was packed well and no damage. The blade has a fine edge on it and shaves easily. I like the hard sheath and the handle feels great. The blade is thick and sturdy and I'm sure I'll get a lot of good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Duncan

customer_reviews.title: awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought two one for myself and my daughter. Knife is perfect super sharp definitely a great buy would buy again a great bushcrafting tool from carving to wood Batoning edge retention wonderful. Sheath not perfect but with a couple mods its definitely a good sheath. I'm very satisfied with my purchase. Cima knifes knows how to make great budget knifes will buy more of their knifes for sure.
customer_reviews.author: tony rob

customer_reviews.title: Good even grinding
customer_reviews.text: This is a outstanding knife for the 22 bucks I spent on it or even at 30. Good even grinding. Great micarta scales. Nice thick blade. I would recommend this knife to anyone on a budgetor just to add to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: An awesome knife at an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe I bought almost the identical knife for 3 times the price. This knife does it all and hardly shows any sign of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: love this knife. not pretty but does the job, holds a edge, and stays in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dave

customer_reviews.title: CIMA High Hardness Full-Tang Outdoor Survival Fixed Blade Hunting Knife
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grand son. He loves it as he collects knives.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Zipay

customer_reviews.title: The best knife for the price, period.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this knife. It is 8 5/16" long and 3mm/ 3/16" thick. This blade has many uses and has been mistaken for an Esee knive that is pretty expensive. And it is sharp. You just cannot best the price. Do yourself a solid and buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: feels very sturdy and looks good. It is a heavy knife and the sheath is not the best fit but for the money it was worth it. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little blade for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at the quality , fit and finish of this little knife. HARD to find a better value . Full tang, 7CR17MOV steel , shaving sharp out of the box. Decent molded plastic sheath for several carry options . All in all ITS A BARGAIN!! It will make a great little starter knife for a youngster getting started in bush crafting , or a knife to throw in the backpack for a day hike .
customer_reviews.author: Richard Croft Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great knife at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Really nicely built Solid tang all the way through. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ric In Richmond

customer_reviews.title: very nice knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: very nice knife for the price. i can not find any weakness still, though on the youtube, some say it is easy to be broken. omitting 1 star is just because of the youtube review. nontheless it is worth as the entry lavvel bushcraft knife. i will check in actual bushcraft.
customer_reviews.author: Seagull

customer_reviews.title: Bear hunting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hunt bears. It’s still winter so I have had the chance but in spring time I think I can get a cub. Or a slower old bear that’s not as fast as he used to be.
customer_reviews.author: greg tennyson

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great function and price. Super knife. What a deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great function and price. Super knife. What a deal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: CIMA High Hardness Full-Tang Outdoor Survival Fixed Blade Hunting Knife
feature_bullets: Which is made of 7CR17MOV steel.It is a Full-Tang outdoor hunting knife
This knife is really suitable for use in camping hunting or presented to your friends, each knife number is unique
This kind of flax textured micarta handles, non-slip, wear-resistant, feel good in the hand
